org.semanticweb.kaon2.api.formatting
Interface OntologyFormatting

public interface OntologyFormatting

Represents the information about how axioms are formatted in an ontology. Formatting is preserved for an ontology only if the parameter "preserveFormatting" is set to Boolean.TRUE in the parameters hashmap when an ontology is opened or created. From the textual point of view, an ontology is a sequence of formatting elements. There are two types of elements: (i) axiom elements correspond to axioms in the ontology, whereas (ii) whitespace elements correspond to whitespace (possibly including comments) that come between axioms. Some implementations of this interface keep formatting only for one type of axioms (for example, to prevent huge memory consumption, one might choose not to preserve formatting for facts). Using cursors one can separately iterate over both classes of axioms.

formattingPreservationEnabled

boolean formattingPreservationEnabled()
                                      throws KAON2Exception
Returns true if formatting prservation has been enabled at ontology creation/opening time. If formatting preservation has not been enabled, then metods that attempt to mutate the state of this object will fail.

Returns:
true if formatting preservation has been enabled
Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error

createPreservedAxiomsCursor

FormattingElementCursor createPreservedAxiomsCursor()
                                                    throws KAON2Exception
Creates a cursor over the axioms whose formating is being preserved. The cursor is positioned before at the first formatting element. (If there are no formatting elements, the cursor is positioned after the last element.)

Returns:
a new cursor over the formatting elements
Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error

createNonPreservedAxiomsCursor

FormattingElementCursor createNonPreservedAxiomsCursor()
                                                       throws KAON2Exception
Creates a cursor over the axioms whose formating is not being preserved. The cursor is positioned before at the first axiom. (If there are no formatting elements, the cursor is positioned after the last element.)

Returns:
a new cursor over the formatting elements
Throws:
KAON2Exception - thrown if there is an error
